doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
Dr Graham Clark Home 1938--William Snead Home 1946--Staircase from Chatrlottesville House--1794 Cocke had a contact with a William Bates to build a house--Called Edgmount in 1810

1 Story Frame, Paired Column Portico, Tetrastyle Portico, North Portico Base Existed, Lunette in Tympanum, Figural Spaces, Center Passage not Through, 5 Bay, Palladian Entry Screen, Brick Nogging, Sanded Rusticated Wood Siding, Dumbwaiter, Dumbwaiter, 6 Panel Doors, Blinds, 9/9, 6/6, Triple Hung Sash, Bay Window, Stone Dovecote, Brick Kitchen, Circular Icehouse, Office, Log Smokehouse, Stone Outbuildings, Log Slave Quarters, Cemetery, Gardens with Stone Walls, 5 Parterres, Bowling Green, Centered on Mountain

Thomas Jefferson, Architect 1793-95 (a jefferson drawing allegedly of the house exists)--William Bates, builder 1794-95--Milton Grigg, Arch: North & East Porticos, 2 Pavilions, Underground Passage, Palladian Entry Screen, Poolhouse 1936, 1946, 1967
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Virginia Road Traces%Mutual Assurance Society Insurance Policy--Work Projects Administration
